content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata> <idinfo> <citation> <citeinfo> <origin>NOAA/NESDIS/NODC/NCDDC - National Coastal Data Development Center</origin> <pubdate>Unknown</pubdate> <title>Submersible Data (Dive Waypoints) for Bioluminescence 2009 - Office of Ocean Exploration and Research</title> <geoform>vector digital data</geoform> <onlink>http://www.ncddc.noaa.gov/arcgis/rest/services/OceanExploration/OECruiseData/MapServer</onlink> </citeinfo> </citation> <descript> <abstract>Data and information collected by the submersible Johnson Sea-Link II at waypoints along its track during seventeen dives of the 2009 "Bioluminescence" expedition sponsored by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Office of Ocean Exploration and Research, July 20 through 31, 2009. Measurements and information include sub's position and depth; personnel assignments; dive, mission, target, and vehicle ID's; and hyperlinks to CTD plots.</abstract> <purpose>This data set was geospatially enabled in order to support NOAA's Office of Ocean Exploration and Research Regional Atlas. It was formatted for incorporation into a Geographic Information System database.</purpose> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <rngdates> <begdate>20090721</begdate> <enddate>20090729</enddate> </rngdates> </timeinfo> <current>ground condition</current> </timeperd> <status> <progress>Complete</progress> <update>None Planned</update> </status> <spdom> <bounding> <westbc>-79.323245</westbc> <eastbc>-77.582535</eastbc> <northbc>27.077232</northbc> <southbc>26.131737</southbc> </bounding> </spdom> <keywords> <theme> <themekt>None</themekt> <themekey>CTD</themekey> <themekey>ocean exploration</themekey> <themekey>bioluminescence</themekey> </theme> <theme> <themekt>ISO 19115 Topic Category</themekt> <themekey>oceans</themekey> </theme> <place> <placekt>None</placekt> <placekey>The Bahamas</placekey> <placekey>Northwest Providence Channel</placekey> </place> </keywords> <accconst>None</accconst> <useconst>None</useconst> <ptcontac> <cntinfo> <cntorgp> <cntorg>NOAA/NESDIS/NODC/NCDDC-National Coastal Data Development Center</cntorg> </cntorgp> <cntaddr> <addrtype>mailing and physical</addrtype> <address>Bldg. 1021, Suite 1003</address> <city>Stennis Space Center</city> <state>MS</state> <postal>39529</postal> <country>USA</country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>228-688-2354</cntvoice> <cntfax>228-688-2968</cntfax> <cntemail>ncddcmetadata@noaa.gov</cntemail> <hours>Monday - Friday, 8am - 5pm, Central Standard Time</hours> </cntinfo> </ptcontac> <datacred>The Harbor Branch Oceanographic Institution (Ft. Pierce, Florida) produced the data from sensors and instruments aboard the manned submersible Johnson-Sea-Link II.  The NOAA Office of Ocean Exploration and Research funded the submersible dives as part of the the Bioluminescence 2009 expedition.</datacred> <progaff> <progname>National Coastal Data Development Center IMS Services</progname> </progaff> </idinfo> <dataqual> <attracc> <attraccr>Unknown</attraccr> </attracc> <logic>Data can be represented geographically as points. No test for spatial relationships between points was performed.</logic> <complete>Each record in the data set is based on the calculated position of the submersible at selected points in time during the dives ("waypoints").  Missing or deleted data are represented as blank cells.</complete> <posacc> <horizpa> <horizpar>Position measured by Differential GPS</horizpar> </horizpa> </posacc> <lineage> <srcinfo> <srccite> <citeinfo> <origin>NOAA/NESDIS/NODC/NCDDC - National Coastal Data Development Center</origin> <pubdate>Unknown</pubdate> <title>Submersible Navigation Waypoint Data from Bioluminescence 2009 Expedition</title> <geoform>tabular digital data</geoform> </citeinfo> </srccite> <typesrc>disc</typesrc> <srctime> <timeinfo> <rngdates> <begdate>20090721</begdate> <enddate>20090729</enddate> </rngdates> </timeinfo> <srccurr>ground condition</srccurr> </srctime> <srccitea>dive_waypts</srccitea> <srccontr>NOAA/NESDIS/NODC/NCDDC - National Coastal Data Development Center</srccontr> </srcinfo> <procstep> <procdesc>Data was delivered in text format for dives which contained date, time, latitude, longitude, dive depth and unit, and comments.  Files were loaded into Excel spreadsheets from which ESRI point shapefiles were created.  Attribute fields (ex. PILOTID) were added and populated by referencing submersible trackpoints data files.  ESRI shapefiles were merged and loaded into Oracle as an SDE layer.</procdesc> <srcused>dive_waypts</srcused> <procdate>200908</procdate> <proccont> <cntinfo> <cntorgp> <cntorg>NOAA/NESDIS/NODC/NCDDC-National Coastal Data Development Center</cntorg> </cntorgp> <cntaddr> <addrtype>mailing and physical</addrtype> <address>Bldg. 1021, Suite 1003</address> <city>Stennis Space Center</city> <state>MS</state> <postal>39529</postal> <country>USA</country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>228-688-2354</cntvoice> <cntfax>228-688-2968</cntfax> <cntemail>ncddcmetadata@noaa.gov</cntemail> <hours>Monday -
